title: ARCS Model-Based Motivational Design for Enhancing e-Learning Quality

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental mobile device usage skills and elementary-level social studies comprehension
context.additional_context: Personalized content delivery via learners' mobile devices (BYOD), with case-based learning linked to real-world problems

learning_goals: Learners can evaluate e-learning content using the four elements (Attention, Relevance, Confidence, Satisfaction) of the ARCS model.
Learners can design three or more microlearning materials in mobile environments, considering usability and motivation.
Learners can derive five or more quality indicators for e-learning modules based on social problem-solving cases.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
